#Net Premiums

## Net Premiums

Insurance and annuity benefits are more commonly purchased by a *series*
of periodic premium payments than by a single premium payment (n.s.p.).
Since premium payments are generally made only while the insured is
living, these premiums form a life annuity.

### Equivalence Principle

$$\mathbb{E}\left\lbrack \text{present value of benefits}\right\rbrack\ = \ \ \mathbb{E}\left\lbrack 
\text{present value of net premiums}\ \right\rbrack$$

i.e., n.s.p. for benefits $=$ n.s.p. for net premiums 

Define $L=$ loss-at-issue random variable     
           
$=$ (p.v. of benefits) $-$ (p.v. of net premiums)

The **Equivalence Principle** states that $\mathbb{E}=0$


### Continuous Premiums, Insurance Payable at the Moment of Death

General:

$Z=$ p.v. of  insurance benefit

$Y=$ p.v.of continuous life annuity following the premium payment pattern

$\bar{P} =$ continuous annual premium

Then $L=Z-\bar{P}Y$ and 

$$\mathbb{E}\left( L \right) = 0 \ \ \Longleftrightarrow \ \ \mathbb{E}\left( Z \right) =
\bar{P} \mathbb{E}\left( Y \right)$$ 

i.e.: $\bar{P} = \frac{\mathbb{E}\left( Z \right)}{\mathbb{E}\left( Y \right)}$


1. **Whole life insurance, level premiums payable for life.**

$$Z=v^{T}$$

$$Y = \bar{a}_{\overline{T|}}$$

Continuous annual premium $= \bar{P}\left( \bar{A}_x \right)=\frac{\mathbb{E}\left( Z \right)}{\mathbb{E}\left( Y \right)} = \frac{\bar{A}_x}{\bar{a}_x}$

$L=v^{t} - \bar{P}\bar{a}_{\overline{T|}}$

$\mathbb{\text{E}}\left( L \right) = 0$

To obtain $\mathbb{\text{Var}}\left( L \right)$

write
$L = v^{T} - \ \bar{P}\left\lbrack \frac{1 - v^{T}}{\delta} \right\rbrack = v^{T}\left\lbrack 1 + \frac{\ \bar{P}}{\delta} \right\rbrack - \frac{\bar{P}}{\delta}$

Then $\mathbb{\text{Var}} \left( L \right) = \left\lbrack 1 + \frac{\bar{P}}{\delta} \right\rbrack ^2
\mathbb{\text{Var}} \left( v^{T} \right) = \left\lbrack 1 + \frac{\bar{P}}{\delta} \right\rbrack ^2
\left\lbrack {\ }^{2}\bar{A}_{x} - \left( \bar{A}_{x} \right)^2 \right\rbrack$

But $\bar{P} = \frac{\bar{A}_{x}}{\bar{a}_{x}} = \frac{1 - \delta \bar{a}_{x}}{\bar{a}_{x}}$

i.e., $1 + \frac{\bar{P}}{\delta} =1 + \frac{1 - \delta{\bar{a}}_{x}}{\delta{\bar{a}}_{x}}= \frac{1}{\delta{\bar{a}}_{x}}$

i.e., $\mathbb{\text{Var}}\left( L \right) = \frac{\left\lbrack {_{\ }^{2}\bar{A}}_{x} - \left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right)^{2} \right\rbrack}{\left( \delta{\bar{a}}_{x} \right)^{2}}$

2. **n-year term insurance, level premiums payable for n years.**

Continuous annual premium $\bar{P} \left( \bar{A}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1} \right)$ solves 

$\bar{P} \bar{a}_{x:\overline{n|}} = \bar{A}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}$

i.e. $\bar{P}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1} \right) = \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}}{{\bar{a}}_{x:\overline{n|}}}$

$L = v^{t} - \bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{t|}}$ when $T = t \leq n$

$\ \ \ \ = - \bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{n|}}$ when $T = t > n$

3. **n-year endowment insurance, level premiums payable for n years.**

Continuous annual premium
$\bar{P}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}} \right)$ satisfies

$$\bar{P}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}} \right)= \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}}{{\bar{a}}_{x:\overline{n|}}}$$

$L = v^{t} - \bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{t|}}$ when $T = t \leq n$

$\ \ \ \ = v^{t} - \bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{n|}}$ when $T = t > n$

4. **h payment, n-year endowment insurance.**

Continuous annual premium
$_{h}^{\ }\bar{P}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}} \right)$ satisfies

$$\bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{x:\overline{h|}} = \ {\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}$$

$$i.e.,\ _{h}^{\ }\bar{P}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}} \right)= \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}}{{\bar{a}}_{x:\overline{h|}}}$$

$L = v^{t} - \bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{t|}}$ when $T = t \leq h$

$\ \ \ \ = v^{t} - \bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{h|}}$ when $hh < T = t \leq n$

$\ \ \ \ = v^{n} - \bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{h|}}$ when $hT = t > n$

5. **h payment, whole life insurance.**

$$_{h}\bar{P}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right) = \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x}}{{\bar{a}}_{x:\overline{h|}}}$$

$L = v^{t} - \bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{t|}}$ when $T = t \leq h$

$\ \ \ \ = v^{t} - \bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{h|}}$ when $hT = t > h$

6. **h payment, n-year term insurance.**

$$_{h}\bar{P}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1} \right) = \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}}{{\bar{a}}_{x:\overline{h|}}}$$

$L = v^{t} - \bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{t|}}$ when $T = t \leq h$

$\ \ \ \ = v^{t} - \bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{h|}}$ when $hh < T = t \leq n$

$\ \ \ \ = - \bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{h|}}$ when $hT = t > n$

**Example 4.1.1**   $L_{1}$ is the loss-at-issue random variable for a
fully continuous whole life insurance of 1 on the life of (x) with a net
level annual premium determined by the equivalence principal.

You are given:

(i) ${\bar{a}}_{x} = 5.0$ 
(ii) $\delta = 0.08$ 
(iii) $\mathbb{\text{Var}}\left( L_{1} \right) = 0.5625$

$L_{2}$ is the loss-at-issue random variable for this insurance with a
premium which is 4/3 times the net level annual premium.

Calculate the sum of the expected value of $L_{2}$ and the standard
deviation of $L_{2}$.

**Solution**

$L_{1} = v^{T} - \bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{T|}} = v^{T} - \bar{P}\left\lbrack \frac{1 - v^{T}}{\delta} \right\rbrack$

$\ \ \ \ = v^{T}\left( 1 + \frac{\bar{P}}{\delta} \right) - \frac{\bar{P}}{\delta}$

But $\bar{P} = \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x}}{{\bar{a}}_{x}}\  = \left( 1 - \delta{\bar{a}}_{x} \right)/{\bar{a}}_{x}$

i.e., $\frac{\bar{P}}{\delta} = \frac{1}{(\delta{\bar{a}}_{x})} - 1$
and $1 + \frac{\bar{P}}{\delta} = \frac{1}{(\delta{\bar{a}}_{x})}$

i.e., $\mathbb{\text{Var}}\left(L_{1} \right) = 0.5625 = \left\lbrack \frac{1}{\left( \delta{\bar{a}}_{x} \right)} \right\rbrack^{2}\left\lbrack {_{\ }^{2}\bar{A}}_{x} - \left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right)^{2} \right\rbrack$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = \ \left\lbrack \frac{1}{0.08(5)} \right\rbrack^{2}\left\lbrack {_{\ }^{2}\bar{A}}_{x} - \left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right)^{2} \right\rbrack\ $

i.e., ${_{\ }^{2}\bar{A}}_{x} - \left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right)^{2} = 0.5625\left( 0.16 \right) = 0.09$

$L_{2} = v^{T} - \frac{4}{3}\bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{T|}} = L_{1} - \frac{1}{3}\bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{T|}}$

$\mathbb{E}\left( L_{2} \right) = \mathbb{E}\left( L_{1} \right) - \ \frac{1}{3}\bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{x} = - \frac{1}{3}\bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{x}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = - \frac{1}{3 {\bar{A}}_{x}}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = - \frac{1}{3 \left( 1 - \delta{\bar{a}}_{x} \right)}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = - \frac{1}{3}\left( 1 - 5(0.08) \right) = - 0.2$

$L_{2} = v^{T} - \frac{4}{3}\bar{P}\left\lbrack \frac{1 - v^{T}}{\delta} \right\rbrack$

$\ \ \ \ = v^{T}\left\lbrack 1 + \frac{\left( \frac{4}{3}\bar{P} \right)}{\delta} \right\rbrack - \frac{\frac{4}{3}\bar{P}}{\delta}$

$\ \ \ \ = v^{T}\left\lbrack 1 + \frac{4}{3}(\left( \frac{1}{\delta{\bar{a}}_{x}} \right) - 1) \right\rbrack - \frac{\frac{4}{3}\bar{P}}{\delta}$

$\ \ \ \ = v^{T}\left\lbrack \frac{4}{3}\left( \frac{1}{\delta{\bar{a}}_{x}} \right) - \frac{1}{3}) \right\rbrack - \frac{\frac{4}{3}\bar{P}}{\delta}$

i.e., $\mathbb{\text{Var}}\left( L_{2} \right) = \ \left\lbrack {_{\ }^{2}\bar{A}}_{x} - \left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right)^{2} \right\rbrack\left\lbrack \frac{4}{3}\left( \frac{1}{0.08(5)} \right) - \frac{1}{3}) \right\rbrack^{2}\  = 0.09(9) =0.81$

i.e., $\text{SD}\left( L_{2} \right) = 0.9$ and $\mathbb{E}\left( L_{2} \right) + \text{SD}\left( L_{2} \right) = - 0.2 + 0.9 = 0.7$

**Example 4.1.2**    L is the loss-at-issue random variable for a fully
continuous whole life insurance of 1 with premiums based on the
equivalence principle.

You are given:

(i) $\mathbb{E}\left( v^{2T} \right) = 0.34$ 
(ii) $\mathbb{E}\left( v^{T} \right) = 0.40$

Calculate $\mathbb{\text{Var}}\left( L \right)$

**Solution**

$L = v^{T} - \bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{x}$

$\ \  = v^{T}\frac{1}{(\delta{\bar{a}}_{x})} - \ \frac{\bar{P}}{\delta}$

$\mathbb{\text{Var}}\left( L \right) = {\left( \frac{1}{\delta{\bar{a}}_{x}} \right)\ }^{2}\left\lbrack {_{\ }^{2}\bar{A}}_{x} - \left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right)^{2} \right\rbrack$

${_{\ }^{2}\bar{A}}_{x} = \mathbb{E}\left( v^{2T} \right) = 0.34$ ;

${\bar{A}}_{x} = \mathbb{E}\left( v^{T} \right) = 0.40$

$\delta{\bar{a}}_{x} = 1 - {\bar{A}}_{x} = 0.6$

i.e., $\mathbb{\text{Var}}\left( L \right) = {\left( \frac{1}{0.6} \right)\ }^{2}\left\lbrack 0.34 - 0.16 \right\rbrack$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = \frac{0.18}{0.36}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = 0.5$

### Continuous Premiums, Life Annuities Payable Continuously

1. **n payment, n year pure premium**

Continuous annual premium $\bar{P}\left( {A\ }_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ 1} \right)$ satisfies
$\bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{x:overline{n|}} = {A}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ 1}$

$$\text{i.e., } \bar{P}\left( {A\ }_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ 1} \right)\  = \frac{{A}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ 1}}{{\bar{a}}_{x:\overline{n|}}}$$

$L = - \bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{t|}}$ when $T = t < n$

$\ \ \ = v^{n} - \bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{n|}}$ when $T = t \geq n$

2. **h payment, n-year endowment insurance.**

$$_{h}\bar{P}\left( {A}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ 1} \right) = \frac{{A}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ 1}}{{\bar{a}}_{x:\overline{h|}}}$$

$L = - \bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{t|}}$ when $T = t < h$

$\ \ \ = - \bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{h|}}$ when $hh \leq T = t < n$

$\ \ \ = v^{n} - \bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{h|}}$ when $hT \geq n$

3. **n payment, n year deferred whole life insurance.**

$$\bar{P} \left(_{\left. \ n \right|}^{\ }{\bar{a}}_{x} \right) = \frac{_{\left. \ n \right|}^{\ }{\bar{a}}_{x}}{{\bar{a}}_{x:\overline{n|}}}$$

$L = - \bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{t|}}$ when $T = t < n$

$\ \ \ = v^{n}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{t - n|}} - \bar{P}{\bar{a}}_{\overline{n|}}$ when $hT = t \geq n$

### Relationships between Net Premiums, Insurances and Annuities

1. **Whole life insurance, premiums payable for life**

$$\bar{P}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right) = \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x}}{{\bar{a}}_{x}} = \frac{1 - \delta{\bar{a}}_{x}}{{\bar{a}}_{x}} = \frac{\delta{\bar{A}}_{x}}{1 - {\bar{A}}_{x}}$$

2.  **n year endowment insurance, premiums payable for n years**

$$\bar{P}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}} \right) = \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}}{{\bar{a}}_{x:\overline{n|}}} = \frac{1 - \delta{\bar{a}}_{x:\overline{n|}}}{{\bar{a}}_{x:\overline{n|}}} = \frac{\delta{\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}}{1 - {\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}}$$

3.  **n year term insurance, premiums payable for n years**

$$\bar{P}\left( \bar{A}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1} \right) = \frac{\bar{A}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}}{\bar{a}_{x:\overline{n|}}} = \frac{1-\delta \bar{a}_{x:\overline{n|}} - _{n}E_{x}}{\bar{a}_{x:\overline{n|}}} = \frac{\delta \bar{A}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}}{1-\bar{A}_{x:\overline{n|}}}$$

**Example 4.1.3** Simplify
$1 - \frac{\left\lbrack \bar{P}\left( {\bar{A}}_{30:\overline{15|}} \right) - _{15}\bar{P}\left( {\bar{A}}_{30} \right) \right\rbrack\left( {\bar{a}}_{30:\overline{15|}} \right)}{\left\lbrack v^{15}(1 - _{15}q_{30}) \right\rbrack}$

**Solution**

$\bar{P}\left( {\bar{A}}_{30:\overline{15|}} \right) = \frac{{\bar{A}}_{30:\overline{15|}}}{{\bar{a}}_{30:\overline{15|}}}$

$_{15}\bar{P}\left( {\bar{A}}_{30} \right) = \frac{{\bar{A}}_{30}}{{\bar{a}}_{30:\overline{15|}}}$

i.e.,
$\left\lbrack \bar{P}\left( {\bar{A}}_{30:\overline{15|}} \right) -_{15}\bar{P}\left( {\bar{A}}_{30} \right) \right\rbrack\left( {\bar{a}}_{30:\overline{15|}} \right) = {\bar{A}}_{30:\overline{15|}}{\bar{A}}_{30}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = {\bar{A}}_{30:\overline{15|}}^{1} +_{15}E_{30} - \left( {\bar{A}}_{30:\overline{15|}}^{1} + {_{15|}\bar{A}}_{30} \right)$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = \ _{15}E_{30} -_{15}{E_{30}{\bar{A}}_{45}}$

$v^{15}\left( 1 -_{15}q_{30} \right) = v^{15}\left(_{15}p_{30} \right) = _{15}E_{30}$

i.e., expression 
$=\frac{1 - \left\lbrack_{15}E_{30} -_{15}E_{30}{\bar{A}}_{45} \right\rbrack}{_{15}E_{30}}$
 
$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = {\bar{A}}_{45}$ 

**Example 4.1.4** A fully continuous whole life insurance of 1 is issued
to (x). You are given the following:

$L = v^{T} - \bar{P}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right){\bar{a}}_{\overline{T|}}$
under the assumption that the force of mortality $\mu_{45}$ equals $\mu$
for all $x$ and the force of interest equals $\delta$.

Calculate $\mathbb{\text{Var}}\left( L \right)$

**Solution**

$L = v^{T} - \bar{P}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right){\bar{a}}_{\overline{T|}} = v^{T} - \frac{\bar{P}\left(1 - v^{T} \right)}{\delta}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = v^{T}\left\lbrack 1 + \frac{\bar{P}}{\delta} \right\rbrack - \frac{\bar{P}}{\delta}$

$\mathbb{\text{Var}}\left( L \right) = \left\lbrack 1 + \frac{\bar{P}}{\delta} \right\rbrack^{2}\left\lbrack {{\ }^{2}\bar{A}}_{x} - \left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right)^{2} \right\rbrack$

$\bar{A}_{x} = \int_{0}^{\infty} v^t \  _{t}p_{x} \mu_{x+t} dt$

$_{t}p_{x} = \exp\left\{ - \int_{x}^{x + t}\mu_{y} dy \right\} = e^{{- \mu}_{t}}$

i.e.,
${\bar{A}}_{x} = \mu\int_{0}^{\infty}v^{t}e^{{- \mu}_{t}} dt = \mu\int_{0}^{\infty}e^{- \delta t}e^{{- \mu}_{t}} dt$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = \mu\int_{0}^{\infty}e^{- \left( \delta + \mu \right)t} dt$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = - \left\lbrack \frac{\mu}{\mu + \delta}\ e^{- \left( \delta + \mu \right)t} \right\rbrack\left| \begin{matrix}\infty \\0 \\\end{matrix}\right.$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = \left\lbrack \frac{\mu}{\mu + \delta} \right\rbrack\ $

${_{\ }^{2}\bar{A}}_{x} = \int_{0}^{\infty} v^{2t} _{t}p_{x} \mu_{x + t} dt = \mu\int_{0}^{\infty}e^{- \left( 2\delta + \mu \right)t} dt$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = \left\lbrack \frac{\mu}{\mu + 2\delta} \right\rbrack$

$1 + \frac{\bar{P}}{\delta} = 1 + \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x}}{{\delta\bar{a}}_{x}} = 1 + \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x}}{1 - {\bar{A}}_{x}} = \frac{1}{1 - {\bar{A}}_{x}} = \frac{1}{\left\lbrack 1 - \frac{\mu}{\mu + \delta} \right\rbrack}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = \frac{\mu + \delta}{\delta}$

i.e.,
$\mathbb{\text{Var}}\left( L \right) = \left\lbrack \frac{\left( \mu + \delta \right)}{\delta} \right\rbrack^{2}\left\lbrack \frac{\mu}{\left( \mu + 2\delta \right)} - \left( \frac{\mu}{\left( \mu + \delta \right)} \right)^{2} \right\rbrack$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = \frac{\left( \mu + \delta \right)^{2}}{\delta^{2}} \frac{\left\lbrack \mu\left( \mu + \delta \right)^{2} - \mu^{2}\left( \mu + 2\delta \right) \right\rbrack}{\left\lbrack \left( \mu + 2\delta \right)\left( \mu + \delta \right)^{2} \right\rbrack}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = \frac{\left\lbrack \mu\left( \mu^{2} + 2\mu\delta + \delta^{2} \right) - \mu^{2}\left( \mu + 2\delta \right) \right\rbrack}{\delta^{2}\left\lbrack \mu + 2\delta \right\rbrack}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = \frac{\mu\delta^{2}}{\delta^{2}\left\lbrack \mu + 2\delta \right\rbrack}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = \frac{\mu}{\left\lbrack \mu + 2\delta \right\rbrack}$

## Fully Discrete Premiums

Recall $T=$ future years lived by (x)

$K=$ future complete years lived by (x)

$\mathbb{P}\left\lbrack K = k \right\rbrack = \ \mathbb{P}\left\lbrack k < T \leq k + 1 \right\rbrack, \ k = 0,1,2,\ldots$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ =_{k |}q_{x}$

1.  **Whole life insurance, benefits payable at the *end* of the year of death, level annual premiums payable for life**

Annual Premium $P_{x}$ satisfies $P_{x}{\ddot{a}}_{x} = A_{x}$. i.e.,
$P_{x} = \frac{A_{x}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x}}$

Define $L =$ loss-at-issue random variable

When $K = k, L = v^{K + 1} - P_{x}{\ddot{a}}_{\overline{k + 1|}}$

![image](Figures\Ch4_01_4.2.JPG)

$L = v^{K + 1} - P_{x}{\ddot{a}}_{\overline{k + 1|}} = v^{K + 1} - P_{x}\left\lbrack \frac{\left( 1 - v^{K + 1} \right)}{d} \right\rbrack$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = v^{K + 1}\left\lbrack 1 + \frac{P_{x}}{d} \right\rbrack - \frac{P_{x}}{d}$

$\mathbb{E}\left( L \right) = {A_{x} - P}_{x}{\ddot{a}}_{x} = 0$

$\mathbb{\text{Var}}\left( L \right) = \left\lbrack 1 + (\frac{P_{x}}{d)} \right\rbrack^{2}\ \left\lbrack ^{2}{A}_{x} - \left( {A}_{x} \right)^{2} \right\rbrack$

But $1 + (\frac{P_{x}}{d)} = 1 + \left( \frac{{A}_{x}}{d{\ddot{a}}_{x}} \right) = \frac{\left\lbrack 1 + (1 - d{\ddot{a}}_{x}) \right\rbrack}{d{\ddot{a}}_{x} = \frac{1}{d{\ddot{a}}_{x}}}$

$\mathbb{\text{Var}}\left( L \right) = \frac{\left\lbrack ^{2}{A}_{x} - \left( {A}_{x} \right)^{2} \right\rbrack}{\left( d{\ddot{a}}_{x} \right)^{2}}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = \frac{\left\lbrack ^{2}{A}_{x} - \left( {A}_{x} \right)^{2} \right\rbrack}{\left\lbrack 1 - \left( {A}_{x} \right)^{2} \right\rbrack}$

2. **h payment, whole life insurance**

Annual premium $_{h}P_{x}$ satisfies
$_{h}P_{x} {\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{h|}} = A_{x}$

$$\text{i.e.,  } _{h}P_{x} = \frac{A_{x}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{h|}}}$$

$L = v^{K + 1} - _{h}P_{x}{\ddot{a}}_{\overline{k + 1|}}$ when $K = k < h$

$\ \ \  = v^{K + 1} - _{h}P_{x}{\ddot{a}}_{\overline{h|}}$ when $K = k \geq h$

3.  **n-year term insurance, level premiums payable for n years**

Annual premium $P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}$ satisfies $P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1} {\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{n|}} = A_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}$

$$\text{i.e.,  } P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1} = \frac{A_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{n|}}}$$

$L = v^{K + 1} - \left( P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1} \right)\ {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{k + 1|}}$ when $K = k < n$

$\ \ \ = - \left( P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1} \right) {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{h|}}$ when $K = k \geq n$

4. **h payment, n year term insurance**

$$_{h}P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1} = \frac{A_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{h|}}}$$

$L = v^{K + 1} - \left(_{h}{P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}} \right)\ {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{k + 1|}}$ when $K = k < h$

$\ \ \  = v^{K + 1} - \left(_{h}{P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}} \right) {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{h|}}$ when $h \leq K = k < n$

$\ \ \  = - \left(_{h}{P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}} \right) {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{h|}}$ when $K = k \geq n$

5. **n payment, n year pure endowment**

$$P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ \ 1} = \frac{A_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ \ 1}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{n|}}}$$

$L = - \left( P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ \ 1} \right) {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{k + 1|}}$ when $K = k < n$

$\ \ \ = v^{n} - \left( P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ \ 1} \right) {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{n|}}$ when $K = k \geq n$

6. **h payment, n year pure endowment**

$$_{h}{P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ \ 1} = }\frac{A_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ 1}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{h|}}}$$

$L = - \left(_{h}{P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ \ 1}} \right){\ddot{a}}_{\overline{k + 1|}}$ when $K = k < h$

$\ \ \  = - \left(_{h}{P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ \ 1}} \right) {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{h|}}$ when $h \leq K = k < n$

$\ \ \  = v^{n} - \left(_{h}{P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ \ 1}} \right){\ddot{a}}_{\overline{h|}}$ when $K = k \geq n$

7. **n payment, n year endowment insurance**

$$P_{x:\overline{n|}} = \frac{A_{x:\overline{n|}}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{n|}}}$$

$L = v^{K + 1} - \left( P_{x:\overline{n|}} \right) {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{k + 1|}}$ when $K = k < n$

$\ \ \ = v^{n} - \left( P_{x:\overline{n|}} \right) {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{n|}}$ when $K = k \geq n$

8. **h payment, n year endowment insurance**

$$_{h}{P_{x:\overline{n|}} = }\frac{A_{x:\overline{n|}}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{h|}}}$$

$L = v^{K + 1} - \left(_{h}{P_{x:\overline{n|}}} \right) {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{k + 1|}}$ when $K = k < h$

$\ \ \ = v^{K + 1} - \left(_{h}{P_{x:\overline{n|}}} \right) {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{h|}}$ when $h \leq K = k < n$

$\ \ \ = v^{n} - \left(_{h}{P_{x:\overline{n|}}} \right) {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{h|}}$ when $K = k \geq n$

**Note**

When the insurance benefit is any amount other than \$1, the resultant
annual premium is multiplied by this amount.

e.g., whole life insurance of \$1000, level annual premiums payable for
life.

${P_{x}}^{*} = 1000\frac{A_{x}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x}} = 1000 P_{x}$

$L^{*} = 1000v^{K + 1} - {P_{x}}^{*} {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{k + 1|}}$

$\ \ \  = 1000\left( v^{K + 1} - P_{x} {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{k + 1|}} \right)$

$\ \ \  = 1000 L$

$\mathbb{\text{Var}}\left( L^{*} \right) = \left( 1000 \right)^{2}\ \mathbb{\text{Var}}\left( L \right)$

9. **n payment , n year deferred whole life annuity due**

$$P(_{n|}{\ddot{a}}_{x}) = \frac{_{n|}{\ddot{a}}_{x}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{n|}}}$$

$L = - P(_{n|}{\ddot{a}}_{x}) {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{k + 1|}}$ when $K = k < n$

$\ \ \  = v^{n}{\ddot{a}}_{\overline{k + 1 - n|}} - \left( P(_{n|}{\ddot{a}}_{x}) \right){\ddot{a}}_{\overline{n|}}$ when $K = k \geq n$

10. **h payment, n year deferred whole life annuity due**

$$_{h}{P(_{n|}{\ddot{a}}_{x}) = }\frac{_{n|}{\ddot{a}}_{x}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{h|}}}$$

$L = - \left(_{h}{P(_{n|}{\ddot{a}}_{x})} \right) {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{k + 1|}}$ when $K = k < h$

$\ \ \  = - \left(_{h}{P(_{n|}{\ddot{a}}_{x})} \right){\ddot{a}}_{\overline{h|}}$ when $h \leq K = k < n$

$\ \ \  = v^{n}{\ddot{a}}_{\overline{k + 1 - n|}} - \left(_{h}{P(_{n|}{\ddot{a}}_{x})} \right){\ddot{a}}_{\overline{hh|}}$ when $K = k \geq n$

**Example 4.2.1** Given $P_{x:\overline{n|}} = 0.042, _{20}P_{35} = 0.0299, A_{55} = 0.6099,$ find the value of
$P_{35:\overline{20|}}^{1}$

**Solution**

$P_{35:\overline{20|}}^{1} = \frac{A_{35:\overline{20|}}^{1}}{{\ddot{a}}_{35:\overline{20|}}}$ 

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = \frac{\left\lbrack A_{35:\overline{20|}} -_{20}E_{35} \right\rbrack}{{\ddot{a}}_{35:\overline{20|}}}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ =  P_{35:\overline{20|}} - \frac{_{20}E_{35}}{{\ddot{a}}_{35:\overline{20|}}} \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ (1)$

But $\ _{20}{E_{35}{A}_{55} = {A}_{35} - A_{35:\overline{20|}}^{1}}$

i.e., $\frac{_{20}E_{35}}{{\ddot{a}}_{35:\overline{20|}}} = \frac{1}{{A}_{55}}\left\lbrack \left( \frac{{\ A}_{35}}{{\ddot{a}}_{35:\overline{20|}}} \right) - \left( \frac{A_{35:\overline{20|}}^{1}}{{\ddot{a}}_{35:\overline{20|}}} \right) \right\rbrack = \frac{1}{{\ A}_{55}}\left\lbrack_{20}P_{35} - P_{35:\overline{20|}}^{1} \right\rbrack$

Substituting into $(1)$,

$$P_{35:\overline{20|}}^{1} = 0.042 - \left( \frac{1}{0.6099} \right)\left\lbrack 0.0299 - P_{35:\overline{20|}}^{1} \right\rbrack$$

i.e., $P_{35:\overline{20|}}^{1}(0.6099) = 0.042(0.6099) - \left\lbrack 0.0299 - P_{35:\overline{20|}}^{1} \right\rbrack$

i.e., $P_{35:\overline{20|}}^{1} = \frac{\left\lbrack 0.0299 - 0.042\left( 0.6099 \right) \right\rbrack}{\left\lbrack 1 - 0.6099 \right\rbrack}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = 0.011$

**Example 4.2.2** A fully discrete whole life insurance of 1 with a
level annual premium is issued to (x). You are given:

(i) $L$ is the loss-at-issue random variable if the premium is based on the Equivalence Principle.

(ii) $\mathbb{\text{Var}}\left( L \right) = 0.75$

(iii) $L^{*}$ is the loss-at-issue random variable if the premium is determined such that $\mathbb{E}\left( L^{*} \right) = - 0.5$

Calculate $\mathbb{\text{Var}}\left( L^{*} \right)$

**Solution**

$L = v^{K + 1} - P_{x} {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{k + 1|}}$; $\ \ \ \ \ \ \ L^{*} = v^{K + 1} - {P_{x}}^{*}{\ddot{a}}_{\overline{k + 1|}}$

$\mathbb{E}\left( L^{*} \right) = A_{x} - {P_{x}}^{*}{\ddot{a}}_{x} = - 0.5$

i.e., ${P_{x}}^{*} = \frac{(A_{x} + 0.5)}{{\ddot{a}}_{x}} = P_{x} + (\frac{0.5}{{\ddot{a}}_{x}})$

$\mathbb{\text{Var}}\left( L^{*} \right) = \left\lbrack 1 + \left( \frac{{P_{x}}^{*}}{d} \right) \right\rbrack^{2}\left\lbrack ^{2}{A}_{x} - \left( {A}_{x} \right)^{2} \right\rbrack$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = \left\lbrack 1 + \left( \frac{P_{x}}{d} \right) + \left( \frac{0.5}{d{\ddot{a}}_{x}} \right) \right\rbrack^{2}\left\lbrack ^{2}{A}_{x} - \left( {A}_{x} \right)^{2} \right\rbrack$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = \left\lbrack \left( \frac{1}{d{\ddot{a}}_{x}} \right) + \left( \frac{0.5}{d{\ddot{a}}_{x}} \right) \right\rbrack^{2}\left\lbrack ^{2}{A}_{x} - \left( {A}_{x} \right)^{2} \right\rbrack$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = 2.25\left( \frac{1}{d{\ddot{a}}_{x}} \right)^{2}\left\lbrack ^{2}{A}_{x} - \left( {A}_{x} \right)^{2} \right\rbrack$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = 2.25 \mathbb{\text{Var}}\left( L \right)$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = 2.25\left( 0.75 \right) = 1.6875$

**Example 4.2.3** You are given:

(i) Deaths are uniformly distributed over each year of age.
(ii) $i = 0.04$ and $\delta = 0.0392$
(iii) $_{n}E_{x} = 0.6$
(iv) ${\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}} = 0.804$

Calculate $1000P({\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}})$

**Solution**

$1000P\left( {\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}} \right) = 1000 \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{n|}}}$

${\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{n|}} = \frac{1 - A_{x:\overline{n|}}}{d}$

$A_{x:\overline{n|}} = A_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1} + _{n}E_{x}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = \left( \frac{\delta}{i} \right){\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1} + _{n}E_{x}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = \left( \frac{\delta}{i} \right)\left\lbrack {\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}} -_{n}E_{x} \right\rbrack + _{n}E_{x}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = \left( \frac{0.0392}{0.04} \right)\left\lbrack 0.804 - 0.6 \right\rbrack + 0.6$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = 0.8$

$d = \frac{i}{(1 + i)} = \frac{0.04}{1.04}$

i.e.,
${\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{n|}} = \frac{\left( 1 - 0.08 \right)(1.04)}{0.04} = 5.2$

i.e.,
$1000P\left( {\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}} \right) = \frac{1000\left( 0.804 \right)}{5.2}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = 154.6$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \approx 155$

**Example 4.2.4** For a special fully discrete whole life insurance of
1000 issued on the life of (75), increasing premiums $\pi_{k}$ are
payable at time $k$, for $k=0,1,2,\ldots $

You are given

(i) $\pi_{k} = \pi_{0}{(1 + i)}^{k}$
(ii) Mortality follows de Moivre's law with $\omega = 105$
(iii) $i = 0.05$; $\ \ \ \ a_{\overline{30|}} = 15.4$ at $i = 0.05$
(iv) Premiums are calculated in accordance with the equivalence principle.

Calculate $\pi_{0}$

**Solution**

$$\mathbb{E}\left( \text{p.v. of premiums} \right) = \mathbb{E}\left( \text{p.v. of benefits} \right)$$

$$\sum_{t=0}^{29} \pi_k v^t \ _{t}p_{75} = 1000 \sum_{t=0}^{29} v^{t+1} \ _{t|}q_{75}$$

$$\pi_{0} \sum_{t = 0}^{29} \ _{t}p_{75} = 1000 \sum_{t=0}^{29} v^{t+1} \ _{t|}q_{75}$$

De Moivre: $_{t}p_{75} \ \mu_{75 + t} = \frac{1}{(\omega - 75)} = \frac{1}{\left( 105 - 75 \right)} = \frac{1}{30}$

$_{t|}q_{75} = \int_{0}^{1}{_{k}p_{75}} \ \mu_{75 + k}\ dk = \frac{1}{30}$

$_{t}p_{75} = 1 - \ _{t}q_{75} = 1 - \frac{t}{30}$

$\sum_{t = 0}^{29}{_{t}p_{75}} = \sum_{t = 0}^{29}{1 - \left( \frac{t}{30} \right)} = 30 - \left( \frac{1}{30} \right)\left\lbrack \frac{29(30)}{2} \right\rbrack = 15.5$

$\sum_{t = 0}^{29}v^{t + 1} \ _{t|}q_{75} = \left( \frac{1}{30} \right)\ a_{\overline{30|}} = 15.4/30$

i.e., $\pi_{0} = \frac{\left\lbrack 1000\left( 15.4 \right) \right\rbrack}{\left\lbrack 15.5\left( 30 \right) \right\rbrack}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = 33.1$

## Annual Premiums, Immediate Payment of Benefits

1. **Whole life insurance, premiums payable for life.**

    $P\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right) = \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x}} \frac{(\frac{i}{\delta})A_{x}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x}} = \frac{(i}{\delta})P_{x}$ under UDD

2. **h payment, whole life insurance.**

    $_{h}{P({\bar{A}}_{x})} = \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{h|}}} = \frac{(i}{\delta}) _{h}P_{x}$ under UDD

3. **n year term insurance, premiums payable for n years.**

    $P\left( {\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1} \right) = \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{n|}}} = (\frac{i}{\delta})P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}$ under UDD

4. **h payment, n year term insurance.**

    $_{h}{P({\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1})} = \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{h|}}} = \frac{i}{\delta} \ _{h}P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}$ under UDD

5. **n year endowment insurance, premiums payable for n years.**

    $P \left( \bar{A}_{x:\overline{n|}} \right) = \frac{ \bar{A}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1} - \bar{A}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ 1} }{\ddot{a}_{x:\overline{n|}}} = \frac{i}{\delta} P_{x:\overline{n|}}^1 + P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ 1}$ under UDD

6. **h payment, n year endowment insurance.**

    $_{h}{P({\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}})} = \frac{({\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1} + {\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ 1})}{{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{h|}}} = \frac{i}{\delta} \ _{h}P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1} +_{h}P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ 1}$ under UDD

**Example 4.3.1** Simplify
$\frac{\left\lbrack P\left( {\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}} \right) - _{n}{P({\bar{A}}_{x})} \right\rbrack}{P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ 1}}$

**Solution**

Expression 
$= \left\lbrack \left( \bar{A}_{x:\overline{n|}} / \ddot{a}_{x:\overline{n|}} \right) - \left( \bar{A}_x / \ddot{a}_{x:\overline{n|}} \right) \right\rbrack / \left( A_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ 1} / \ddot{a}_{x:\overline{n|}} \right)$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = \left\lbrack \left( {\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1} + A_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ 1} \right) - \left( {\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1} + A_{x:\overline{n|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ 1} \cdot {\bar{A}}_{x + n} \right) \right\rbrack / \left(A_{\ x:\overset{\overline{}}{\left. \ \text{ n} \right|}}^{\ \ \ \ \ \ \ 1} / {\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{n|}} \right)$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \   = 1 - {\bar{A}}_{x + n}$

### Monthly Payment Premiums

$P_{x}^{(m)} =$ net level premium, payable in m^th^ly installments of
$(\frac{1}{m})P_{x}^{(m)}$ at the **beginning** of each m^th^ of a year,
for \$1 of insurance payable at the **end** of the year death.

1. **Whole life insurance, m^th^ly premiums payable for life.**

    $P_{x}^{(m)} = \frac{A_{x}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x}^{(m)}} = \frac{d^{(m)}A_{x}}{1 - A_{x}^{(m)}} = \frac{d^{(m)}A_{x}}{1 - (\frac{i}{i^{(m)}})A_{x} }$ under UDD

2. **Whole life insurance, m^th^ly premiums payable for h years.**

    $_{h}P_{x}^{(m)} = \frac{A_{x}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{h|}}^{(m)}} = \frac{A_{x}}{\left( {\ddot{a}}_{x}^{\left( m \right)} - _{h}{E_{x}{\ddot{a}}_{x + h}^{(m)}} \right)}$

    $\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = \frac{\left( d^{(m)}A_{x} \right)}{\left\lbrack \left( 1 - A_{x}^{(m)} \right) - _{h}{E_{x}\left( 1 - A_{x + hh}^{(m)} \right)} \right\rbrack}$

    $\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = \frac{\left( d^{(m)}A_{x} \right)}{\left\lbrack \left( 1 - _{h}E_{x} \right) - (\frac{i}{i^{(m)}})A_{x:\overline{h|}}^{1} \right\rbrack}$ under UDD

3. **n year term insurance, m^th^ly premiums payable for n years.**

    ${P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}}^{(m)} = \frac{A_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{h|}}^{(m)}} = \frac{\left( d^{(m)}A_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1} \right)}{\left\lbrack \left( 1 - _{n}E_{x} \right) - (\frac{i}{i^{(m)}})A_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1} \right\rbrack}$ under UDD

4. **n year term insurance, m^th^ly premiums payable for h years.**

    $_{h}{P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}}^{(m)} = \ \frac{A_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{h|}}^{(m)}} = \frac{\left( d^{(m)}A_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1} \right)}{\left\lbrack \left( 1 -_{h}E_{x} \right) - (\frac{i}{i^{(m)}})A_{x:\overline{h|}}^{1} \right\rbrack}$ under UDD

5. **n year endowment, m^th^ly premiums payable for n years.**

    $P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{(m)} = \frac{A_{x:\overline{n|}}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{(m)}} = \frac{\left( d^{(m)}A_{x:\overline{n|}} \right)}{\left\lbrack \left( 1 -_{n}E_{x} \right) - (\frac{i}{i^{(m)}})A_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1} \right\rbrack}$ under UDD

6. **n year endowment, m^th^ly premiums payable for n years.**

    $_{h}P_{x:\overline{n|}}^{(m)} = \frac{A_{x:\overline{n|}}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{h|}}^{(m)}} = \frac{\left( d^{(m)}A_{x:\overline{n|}} \right)}{\left\lbrack \left( 1 -_{h}E_{x} \right) - (\frac{i}{i^{(m)}})A_{x:\overline{h|}}^{1} \right\rbrack}$ under UDD

The formulas are similar when the insurance is payable at the **moment** of death.

e.g., 
$P_{x}^{(m)}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right)\ =$ net level annual premium, payable in m^th^ly installments of $(\frac{1}{m})P_{x}^{(m)}$ at the **beginning** of each m^th^ of a
year, for \$1 of insurance payable at the **moment** of death.

**Example 4.3.1** Find the net annual premium payable semi-annually for
a whole life insurance of \$100,000 to (30), based on the Illustrative
Life Table at $i = 6\%,\frac{i}{i^{(2)}} = 1.01, d^{(2)} = 0.057$. 
Assume the Uniform distribution of Deaths within each age.

**Solution**

Want $100,000P_{30}^{(2)} = 100,000 \frac{A_{30}}{{\ddot{a}}_{30}^{(2)}}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = 100,000 \frac{d^{(2)}A_{30}}{\left\lbrack 1 - \left( \frac{i}{i^{(2)}} \right)A_{30\ } \right\rbrack}$ under UDD

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = \frac{\left\lbrack 100\left( 102.48 \right)\left( 0.057 \right) \right\rbrack}{\left\lbrack 1 - 1.01\left( 0.10248 \right) \right\rbrack}$ from table

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = \$ 652$

i.e., semi-annual premium is \$326.

### Apportionable Premiums

Here, premiums are paid m^th^ly, the death benefit is
payable at the moment of death and a refund of premium is made based on
the time of death and the time of the next premium payment.

Recall ${\ddot{a}}_{x}^{\{ m\}} =$ n.s.p. for an
m^th^ly paying life annuity of (1/m) at the
*beginning* of each m^th^ of a year with a refund of the "unearned" premium at death.

$P_{x}^{\{ m\}}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right) =$
apportionable whole life premium paid m^th^ly based on
the same refund feature as ${\ddot{a}}_{x}^{\{ m\}}$

i.e., $P_{x}^{\{ m\}}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right)$ satisfies
$P_{x}^{\{ m\}}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right){\ddot{a}}_{x}^{\{ m\}} = \ {\bar{A}}_{x}$

i.e.,
$P_{x}^{\left\{ m \right\}}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right) = \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x}^{\left\{ m \right\}}}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = \ \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x}}{\left\lbrack \left( \frac{\delta}{d^{\left( m \right)}} \right){\bar{a}}_{x} \right\rbrack}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = \ \left( \frac{\delta}{d^{\left( m \right)}} \right)\left( \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x}}{{\bar{a}}_{x}} \right)$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = \ \left( \frac{d^{\left( m \right)}}{\delta} \right)\bar{P}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right)\ $

i.e.,
$\frac{1}{m}P_{x}^{\left\{ m \right\}}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right) = \ \left( \frac{d^{\left( m \right)}}{\delta} \right)\bar{P}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right)$ is payable at the *beginning* of each m^th^ of a year.

In particular for $m =1, P_{x}^{\left\{ 1 \right\}}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right) =$ apportionable whole life premium payable at the *beginning* of the year for an insurance benefit of \$1 payable at the *moment* of death,
together with a premium refund feature.

Since $P_{x}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right) =$ annual premium for a similar benefit *without* the refund feature, it follows that
$P_{x}^{\left\{ 1 \right\}}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right) - P_{x}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right) =$
net level annual premium for the refund-of-premium feature.

$P\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right)^{\text{PR}} = \ \left( \frac{d}{\delta} \right)\left( \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x}}{{\bar{a}}_{x}} \right) - \left( \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x\ }} \right)$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = \left( \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x}}{{\bar{a}}_{x}} \right)\left\lbrack \frac{d}{\delta} - \left( \frac{{\bar{a}}_{x}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x}} \right) \right\rbrack$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = \left( \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x}}{{\bar{a}}_{x}} \right)\left\lbrack \frac{\left( d{\ddot{a}}_{x}\delta\ {\bar{a}}_{x} \right)}{\delta}\cdot {{\ddot{a}}_{x\ }} \right\rbrack$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = \left( \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x}}{{\bar{a}}_{x}} \right)\left\lbrack \frac{\left( \left( 1 - A_{x} \right)\left( 1 - {\bar{A}}_{x} \right) \right)}{\delta} \cdot {{\ddot{a}}_{x\ }} \right\rbrack$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} - A_{x} \right)}{\delta} {{\bar{a}}_{x}\ {\ddot{a}}_{x\ }}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} - A_{x} \right)}{\left( 1 - {\bar{A}}_{x} \right){\ddot{a}}_{x}}$

**Note**

The formula for apportionable premiums for other types of insurance
benefits can be similarly obtained.

e.g.,
$_{h}{P^{\left\{ m \right\}}({\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1})} = \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}}{{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{h|}}^{\{ m\}}} = \ \left( \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x:\overline{n|}}^{1}}{{\bar{a}}_{x:\overline{h|}}} \right)\frac{d^{(m)}}{\delta} =$ apportionable premium for an h-pay m^th^ly paying n year continuous term insurance on (x)

**Example 4.3.2** You are given

(i) $A_{x} = 0.2$ 
(ii) $i = 0.05$ 
(iii) $\frac{i}{i^{(\infty)}} = 1.0248$

Assume deaths are uniformly distributed over each year of age. Calculate
$10,000 P^{\left\{ 1 \right\}}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right) - 10,000P({\bar{A}}_{x})$

**Solution**

Expression =
$10,000 P\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right)^{\text{PR}} = 10,000\left\lbrack \frac{{\bar{A}}_{x}\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} - A_{x} \right)}{\left( 1 - {\bar{A}}_{x} \right)\ {\ddot{a}}_{x}} \right\rbrack$

${\bar{A}}_{x} = \left( \frac{i}{\delta} \right) A_{x} = \frac{i}{i^{(\infty)}}A_{x} = 0.2\left( 1.0248 \right) = 0.20469$

${\ddot{a}}_{x} = \frac{\left( 1 - A_{x} \right)}{d} = \frac{\left( 1 - A_{x} \right)(1 + i)}{i} = \ \frac{\left( 1 - 0.2 \right)(1.05)}{0.05} = 16.8$

$10,000\ P\left( {\bar{A}}_{x} \right)^{\text{PR}} = 10,000\left\lbrack \frac{0.20496\left( 0.20496 - 0.2 \right)}{\left( 1 - 0.20496 \right)\ 16.8} \right\rbrack$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = 0.76$

### Illustration of Net Level Premium Calculations

**Example 4.3.4 **

A)  Determine the net annual premium for a whole life insurance of \$1000 issued to (x) using $i = 0.25$ and the following mortality rates:

$$q_{x} = 0.5\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ q_{x + 1} = 0.9\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ q_{x + 2} = 1$$

**Solution**

Net annual premium = $1000P_{x}$ where $P_{x}$ satisfies

$$P_x \sum_{t=0}^2 v^t \ _tp_x = \sum_{t=0}^2 v^{t+1} \ _{t|}q_x$$

$v = \frac{1}{1 + i} = \frac{1}{1.25} = 0.8$

  Age    q     p     $_tp$   $_{t|}q$   $v^{t}$   $v^t \ _{t}p$     $v^{t+1}\ _{t|}q$
------ ----- ----- -------- ---------- --------- ----------------- -------------------
  x    0.5   0.5    0.5       0.5       0.8             1                 0.4
  x+1  0.9   0.1    0.05      0.45      0.64            0.4               0.288
  x+2  1     1      0         0.05      0.512           0.032             0.0256
                                                        1.432             0.7136

i.e.,
$P_{x}\left( 1.432 \right) = 0.7136 \  \Longrightarrow \ P_{x} = 0.49832$

i.e., net annual premium ${1000P}_{x} = \$ 498.32$

B)  Verify that $\mathbb{E}\left( L \right) = 0$ where $L =$ loss-at-issue random variable

$$L = v^{K + 1} - P{\ddot{a}}_{\overline{k + 1|}}$$

  K   $1000(v^{K + 1})$   ${\ddot{a}}_{\overline{k + 1|}}$   $P{\ddot{a}}_{\overline{k + 1|}}$    $L$      Prob.
----- ------------------- --------------------------------- ----------------------------------- -------- --------- 
  0       800                     1                                   498.3                       301.7    0.5
  1       640                     1.8                                 897.0                       -257.0   0.45
  2       512                     2.44                                1215.9                      -703.9   0.05

$$\mathbb{E}\left( L \right) = 301.7\left( 0.5 \right) - 257.0\left( 0.45 \right) - 703.9\left( 0.05 \right) = 0$$

C)  If 100 such policies are sold, show that the premiums collected, with interest, will be sufficient to pay all death benefits, if actual mortality equals expected mortality assumed in pricing.

 
  Duration    Beginning   Premiums   Interest   Benefits   Ending Fund                                         
 ----------- ----------- ---------- ---------- ---------- -------------- 
    1          0           49,832     12,458     50,000     12,291
    2          12,291      24,916     9,302      45,000     1,508
    3          1,508       2,492      1,000      5,000      0

i.e., if premiums are calculated in accordance with the Equivalence
Principle, then if everyone dies in accordance with the mortality used

## Commutation Functions

**General formula:**

(net annual premium) $\times$ (expected p.v. of annuity based on premium paying pattern)

= (expected p.v. of insurance benefit)

Can express annuity and insurance pieces in commutation form and hence
solve for the net annual premium in commutation symbols.

**Example 4.4.1**

a.  Obtain a formula in commutation symbols for the net annual premium,
    payable for five years for a ten year deferred, 20 year temporary
    immediate annuity of 1 to (30)

**Solution**

$\mathbb{E}$ (p.v. of premium payments)

  X:   30   31   32   33   34   35   ...
  ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- -----
  D:   P    P    P    P    P    0    ...
  N:   P    0    0    0    0    -P   ...

i.e., $\mathbb{E}$ (p.v. of premium payments) $= \frac{P(N_{30} - N_{35})}{D_{30}}$

$\mathbb{E}$ (p.v. of deferred annuity)

  X:   30   31   ...  39   40   41   42   ...  59   60   61   ...
  ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- -----
  D:   0    0    ...  0    0    1    1    ...  1    1    0    ...
  N:   0    0    ...  0    0    1    0    ...  0    0    -1   ...

$\mathbb{E}$ (p.v. of deferred annuity) $= \frac{(N_{41} - \ N_{61})}{D_{30}}$

i.e.,
$\frac{P(N_{30} - N_{35})}{D_{30}} = \frac{(N_{41} - N_{61})}{D_{30}}$

i.e., $P = \frac{(N_{41} - N_{61})}{(N_{30} - N_{35})}$

b.  Find the net annual premium if the annuity in (a) has the additional
    provision that the net premiums paid will be returned in the event
    of death within the 10 year period.

**Solution**

$\mathbb{E}$ (p.v. of return of premium benefit)

  X:   30   31   32   33   34   35   ...  38   39   40    41   ...
  ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- ----- ---- ----
  C:   P    2P   3P   4P   5P   5P   ...  5P   5P   0     0    ...
  M:   P    P    P    P    P    0    ...  0    0    -5P   0    ...
  R:   P    0    0    0    0    -P   ...  0    0    -5P   5P   ...

i.e., $\mathbb{E}$ (p.v. of return of premium benefit) $= P\frac{\left( R_{30} - R_{35} - 5R_{40} + 5R_{41} \right)}{D_{30}}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = P\frac{(R_{30} - R_{35} - 5R_{40})}{D_{30}}$

i.e.,
$\frac{P(N_{30} - N_{35})}{D_{30}} = \left\lbrack \frac{(N_{41} - N_{61})}{D_{30}} \right\rbrack + \left\lbrack P\frac{(R_{30} - R_{35} - 5R_{40})}{D_{30}} \right\rbrack$

i.e.,
$P = \frac{(N_{41} - N_{61})}{\left\lbrack \left( N_{30} - N_{35} \right) - (R_{30} - R_{35} - 5R_{40}) \right\rbrack}$

## Accumulation Type Benefits

Arises when in the event of death within a prescribed period, we have
the additional benefit of either

a.  Return of net premiums without interest, or 
b.  Return of net premiums with interest

When the interest rate in (b) is the same as that used in determining
the net premiums, explicit formulas for the net annual premium can be
obtained.

**Example 4.5.1** Find the net annual premium for a \$5,000, 20 year
term insurance on (x) which provides in case of death within the first
10 years, the additional benefit of net annual premiums paid.

a.  without interest
b.  with interest same as that used in determining premiums.

**Solution**

a.  Net annual premium P solves

$P{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{20|}} = 5000A_{x:\overline{20|}}^{1} + P\sum_{t = 0}^{9}{\left( t + 1 \right)v^{t + 1}} _{t}q_{x}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \  = 5000A_{x:\overline{20|}}^{1} + P{(IA)}_{x:\overline{10|}}^{1}$

i.e.,
$P = \frac{5000A_{x:\overline{20|}}^{1}}{\left\lbrack {\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{20|}} - {(IA)}_{x:\overline{10|}}^{1} \right\rbrack}$

b.  Now $P{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{20|}} = 5000A_{x:\overline{20|}}^{1} + P\sum_{t = 0}^{9}{{\ddot{s}}_{\overline{t + 1 |}}v^{t + 1}} _{t|}q_{x}$



$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = 5000A_{x:\overline{20|}}^{1} + P \sum_{t=0}^{9} \ddot{a}_{\overline{t + 1|}} \ _{t|}q_{x}$

$\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ = 5000A_{x:\overline{20|}}^{1} + P\left\lbrack {\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{10|}} - {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{10|}}\ _{10}p_{x} \right\rbrack$

i.e.,
$P = \frac{5000A_{x:\overline{20|}}^{1}}{\left\lbrack {\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{20|}} - {\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{10|}} + {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{10|}}\ _{10}p_{x} \right\rbrack}$

**Example 4.5.2** Find the net annual for a special 20 year insurance on
(x) which provides a death benefit of \$5000 if death occurs after two
years and the return of the net annual premium paid

a.  without interest
b.  with interest(same as that used in calculating premiums) if death
    occurs within the first two years.

**Solution**

a. $P{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{20|}} = 5000(A_{x:\overline{20|}}^{1} - A_{x:\overline{2|}}^{1}) + P{(IA)}_{x:\overline{2|}}^{1}$

i.e.,
$P = \frac{5000\left\lbrack A_{x:\overline{20|}}^{1} - A_{x:\overline{2}}^{1} \right\rbrack}{{(IA)}_{x:\overline{2|}}^{1}}$

b.  $P{\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{20|}} = 5000\left\lbrack A_{x:\overline{20|}}^{1} - A_{x:\overline{2|}}^{1} \right\rbrack + P\left\lbrack {\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{2|}} - {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{2|}}\ _{2}p_{x} \right\rbrack$

i.e.,
$P = \frac{5000\left\lbrack A_{x:\overline{20|}}^{1} - A_{x:\overline{2|}}^{1} \right\rbrack}{\left\lbrack {\ddot{a}}_{x:\overline{20|}} - {\ddot{a}}_{\ x:\overline{2|}} + {\ddot{a}}_{\overline{2|}}\ _{2}p_{x} \right\rbrack}$
